business.headline: Planning to change jobs? Why you should not withdraw your PFA new job usually means better prospects and a fresh start. Yet, in the rush to move on, one costly mistake is common: withdrawing your PF. What feels like easy money today can hurt your long-term financial security.

Tax refund put on hold under risk management? What the message meansA sudden message from the income tax department has unsettled many taxpayers, who are unsure why their returns are under review. Here is all you need to know.
Sensex, Nifty give up early gains to end lower as investors book profitsThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 42.64 points to close at 85,524.84, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 4.75 points to end at 26,177.15.

Buy now or wait? Why delaying a home purchase can cost you more than you expectIs waiting really the wiser choice for homebuyers, or can rising prices turn patience into a costly mistake? Let's break it down.

VRS or early retirement? Why your PF needs a new story for a new lifeVoluntary Retirement Schemes, or VRS, and early exits, once seen as dramatic decisions, have now become part of real conversations in many households.

Your bank says you need home loan insurance. But is it really mandatory?Banks often push insurance at the final stage of a home loan, leaving many borrowers unsure of what they must agree to. Is it actually mandatory to take that insurance?

IRFC shares jump 5%: Why is the railway stock rising today?Shares of Indian Railway Finance Corporation Ltd, also known as IRFC, have been rebounding after a long correction. The stock had touched a record high of Rs 229 in July last year.

8th Pay Commission: Will central government employees see salary hike in 2026?With the 7th Pay Commission ending in December 2025, are government employees now headed for a 20–35% salary hike under the 8th Pay Commission? Let's understand here.

Got a strict ITR mismatch message from the tax department? Here's what it meansThe communication has caused anxiety because of its wording, which tells taxpayers that not responding "may be construed as a deliberate choice" and that such cases may be taken up for detailed investigation.

How to build portfolios that survive market stormsMarket risk is far more visible than other risks on account of associated volatility, leading investors to confuse safety with low volatility. A stable investment can also quietly erode wealth if it fails to beat inflation or lacks liquidity.

Explained: Why Belrise Industries share price rose 13% todayBelrise stock: The share price moved higher after a large block deal took place and after the company announced a new strategic partnership in the defence space.
Why do your financial plans fail even when markets perform well?Strong markets should mean stable financial plans. So why do many plans fall apart? Here's what often goes wrong.

ITR refund put on hold? Here's what's actually going onThe growing wait for refunds has left taxpayers looking for answers, and the real question is what exactly has changed this year to make the process feel slower than most expected.

IRCTC out of F&O from February 2026. What it means for tradersWith IRCTC set to move out of the F&O segment next year, the real question now is how the stock will trade once derivatives dry up and only cash-market cues remain.

Is it too late to buy gold, silver as prices hit record high?With gold and silver smashing past every previous record, the question now is whether this rally still has fuel left, or if investors risk entering just as the momentum begins to fade.

Bourbon maker Jim Beam halts production at flagship distillery for one yearJim Beam is owned by Suntory Global Spirits, a Japanese drinks group that employs more than 1,000 people across its locations in Kentucky. The company said that its other operations in the state will continue to function as normal.

Gold, silver hit record highs: What's driving the rally and should you buy now?A year that began with steady caution is ending with investors sprinting back to precious metals, turning gold and silver into the market's loudest signal of global unease.

Ambuja Cements shares jump 2% today. Here's why it's risingThe Ambuja Cements stock opened firm and held its momentum, signalling that the Street is clearly buying into the long-term strategic repositioning that the Adani Group is attempting in its cement business.

Sensex, Nifty open slighly lower in early trade as IT stocks fallThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 58.36 points at 85,509.12 around 9:22 am, while the NSE Nifty50 slipped 20.20 points to 26,152.20. Most broader market indices also traded marginally lower.

National Farmers Day 2025: Top 10 schemes supporting farmers across IndiaOn National Farmers Day 2025, it is important to understand the key central government schemes that continue to support farmers with income support, insurance, credit, infrastructure and technology.

entertainment.headline: Ali Fazal posts Mirzapur: The Film BTS, calls Rajasthan home Ali Fazal has shared a behind-the-scenes glimpse from the shoot of Mirzapur: The Film, currently underway in Rajasthan. The much-anticipated cinematic extension of the popular OTT series promises a grand theatrical release across India in 2026.

Homebound in legal heat as author alleges film copied 2021 novel, Dharma reacts Dharma Productions addressed plagiarism allegations related to the film Homebound through legal channels after author Puja Changoiwala accused them of copying her 2021 novel. The dispute arises as the film, India's official entry for the Oscars, continues its campaign.

Prakash Raj wraps key schedule for SS Rajamouli's Varanasi, posts update from set Actor Prakash Raj has completed an important shooting schedule of the much-anticipated film Varanasi, directed by SS Rajamouli. The film stars Mahesh Babu, Priyanka Chopra Jonas, and Prithviraj Sukumaran, and is set for a grand release in 2027.

Pro Bono review: Jung Kyung-ho legal drama finds its voice in society's blind spotRelease Date:Sat Dec 06, 2025 Netflix's Korean legal drama Pro Bono explores themes of power, ambition, and justice through the fall and redemption of a high-profile judge who joins a pro bono legal team. It is streaming on Netflix.

Avengers: Doomsday teaser hints at Steve Rogers' new chapter. Watch here The first look at Avengers: Doomsday confirms Chris Evans' comeback. It also teases a multiversal conflict involving familiar Marvel characters, with the film set to arrive in cinemas in December 2026.

Hrithik Roshan dances to dhol beats at cousin's wedding, videos go viral Hrithik Roshan was seen dancing with family members during the baraat at his cousin's wedding, with videos from the celebrations circulating on social media. The actor attended the event with his sons, while other members of the Roshan family, including Rakesh Roshan, were also present.

Women's Commission issues notice to actor Sivaji over heroines' dressing remark The Women's Commission has issued a notice to Telugu actor Sivaji over his remarks on women's dressing, asking him to appear before the panel on December 27. Following backlash on social media, Sivaji apologised, stating his words were poorly chosen though his intention was not to insult anyone.

Actor Sivaji apologises for women's dressing remarks, claims he referred to heroines Actor Sivaji has apologised following backlash over his remarks about women's choice of clothes at the Dhandoraa pre-release event. The apology came a few hours after his statements drew widespread criticism from the public and film industry personalities.

Sigma teaser: Sundeep Kishan fronts Jason Sanjay's youth-driven vigilante tale The teaser for Sigma, directed by Jason Sanjay and starring Sundeep Kishan, offers a visually striking look at a new kind of action-adventure film aimed at a younger audience.

RGV tears into Sivaji's dress code sermon for women, calls him uncouth and dirty Ram Gopal Varma openly criticised Telugu actor Sivaji for his statements about women's clothing. He referred to the actor as a "dirty guy" and asked him to stop moral policing.

Thalapathy Vijay's Jana Nayagan to release as Jan Neta in Hindi Jana Nayagan has been titled Jan Neta in Hindi. The film, directed by H Vinoth and featuring Thalapathy Vijay and Bobby Deol, will release in January 2026.

In Dhurandhar, Ranveer Singh is a volcano waiting to erupt: Vikramaditya Motwane Filmmaker Vikramaditya Motwane believes Ranveer Singh's full potential is still untapped, calling him "like a volcano waiting to erupt" as the actor earns praise for Dhurandhar.

Saat Samundar Paar remains in Tu Meri Main Tera as court dismisses stay on song The Bombay High Court has refused urgent relief in the copyright dispute over Saat Samundar Paar song, allowing the song to remain in Dharma Productions' upcoming film Tu Meri Main Tera Main Tera Tu Meri.

Ahaan Panday gives Tu Meri Saiyaara callback to fans on 28th birthday. See pic Ahaan Panday received an outpouring of love from fans and colleagues as he celebrated his 28th birthday. The actor shared a heartfelt post thanking all on the special day.

Harsh Chhaya's now-deleted cryptic post sparks online speculation Harsh Chhaya's deleted Facebook post has now gone viral. In the post, the actor reflected on an unnamed actor couple who reportedly divorced around 25 to 30 years ago.

Vidyut Jammwal pours hot candle wax on face in viral video. Watch Actor Vidyut Jammwal's daring stage act involving hot candle wax and a blindfold has captured attention online, sparking widespread discussion about discipline and the influence of traditional martial arts.

Diljit Dosanjh remembers late singer Ustad Puran Shah Koti: Irreplaceable loss Diljit Dosanjh paid an emotional tribute to late Punjabi music legend Ustad Puran Shah Koti, calling his death an "irreplaceable loss for the music industry."

Kiara Advani shot for 7 months while pregnant, told her baby mama's only acting Kiara Advani reveals she filmed for seven months while pregnant, spoke to her unborn child during intense scenes, and says motherhood has reshaped her work choices.

Is Vijay Deverakonda's Rowdy Janardhana a sibling to Kingdom and The Paradise?  Vijay Deverakonda's Rowdy Janardhana announces a darker turn, but early comparisons raise questions about timing, originality, and the cost of familiar aesthetics.

general news.headline: Congress-era illegal mining led to new Aravalli definition: Environment MinisterAravalli Hills row: Environment Minister Bhupender Yadav said that defining the Aravalli was the need of the hour as there was "rampant illegal mining" in Rajasthan. "Today, out of the 1,008 mines operating in Rajasthan, 700 were set up under Ashok Gehlot," he told India Today TV.

Epstein told Larry Nassar 'President shares love of young girls' in apparent Trump hintA letter making a crude reference to President Donald Trump, purportedly from Jeffrey Epstein to Larry Nassar, was released by the Justice Department, sparking denials of allegations and questions regarding its authenticity.

Odisha under fire after buying Rs 12-crore modified Thars for forest rangersThe Odisha Forest Department's procurement and costly modification of the Thar SUVs has sparked widespread criticism, prompting an official audit to review the spending and approval process for these expenditures.

Libya's army chief, 4 others killed as private jet crashes after takeoff in AnkaraLibya's top military commander, Gen. al-Haddad, and four others were killed when their private jet crashed shortly after departing Turkey's Ankara. They had attended defence talks and Turkish authorities have launched an investigation.

The Aravalli you've never seen: 3D maps reveal a vanishing mountain rangeA visual illustration of the mountain peaks, along with satellite checks on human-induced activities, lays bare the Aravalli's crisis.

Tax refund put on hold under risk management? What the message meansA sudden message from the income tax department has unsettled many taxpayers, who are unsure why their returns are under review. Here is all you need to know.

Explosion rips through Pennsylvania nursing home, residents feared trappedInitial reports suggested a possible gas leak may have triggered the explosion, though officials had not confirmed the cause. The blast sent emergency crews rushing to the scene as thick smoke and fire were reported at the facility.

Robert Vadra backs wife Priyanka as India's PM: Will happen, it's inevitableRobert Vadra's remarks came in response to Congress MP Imran Masood saying that Priyanka, like her grandmother, would prove to be a strong Prime Minister.

Joke's on India: Vijay Mallya, Lalit Modi party, laugh about their fugitive statusA new video shows Lalit Modi mockingly calling himself and Vijay Mallya India's "biggest fugitives," a brazen dig at the government and a flaunting display of camaraderie with the fugitive businessman.

Yunus working personally to mend India ties: Bangladesh leader offers olive branchBangladesh's finance adviser Salehuddin Ahmed moved for reconciliation as ties between Delhi and Dhaka seemed to be in a free fall. He said that the head of the interim administration, Muhammad Yunus, was personally working to mend India-Bangladesh ties.

Trump on 8 Epstein flights: 30,000 new files released in largest document dumpAn email from the Epstein files shows Trump flew on Epstein's private jet eight times between 1993 and 1996, including one flight with only Epstein, Trump, and a 20-year-old.

Russian flight attendant stabbed to death by ex over escort work suspicionsThe 25-year-old woman, identified by Russian media as Anastasia, was found dead in her room at the five-star Voco Bonnington hotel with at least 15 stab wounds to her neck, torso and limbs.

IFS officer issues warning after red fox spotted in Ladakh's Pangong lakeThe video shared by Instagram user Vibhor Srivastava showing a red fox roaming near Pangong Tso in Ladakh has gone viral. IFS officer Parveen Kaswan has shared an advisory regarding it.

Leaked 60 Minutes report raises torture claims in Trump-era deportationsA pulled 60 Minutes report alleging abuse of migrants deported under Trump has leaked online, triggering debate over CBS's editorial independence and renewed scrutiny of leadership decisions.

A Pakistan-Bangladesh defence deal with eye on India? Buzz intensifiesIn recent months, senior Pakistani military officials, including the ISI chief, have frequented Bangladesh. Pakistan is keen on signing the defence deal before the elections, under a favourable Muhammad Yunus regime.

Did Delhi-NCR see severe+ AQI days or not? Environment Minister clarifiesBhupender Yadav clarified that his statement in the Rajya Sabha was accurate for the period before the AQI surpassed 450 in December.

Green card lottery paused in US amid H-1B row: What it means for IndiansThe US has suspended the green card lottery amid growing scrutiny of immigration and an ongoing H-1B visa backlash. While Indians were already ineligible, the move deepens uncertainty for students and professionals planning long-term US careers, forcing aspirants to rethink timelines, risks and alternative global pathways.

Might kill me, my family: Unnao rape survivor's sister on Kuldeep Sengar's bailThe family of the Unnao rape survivor said they felt unsafe after the Delhi High Court granted bail to former Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) legislator Kuldeep Singh Sengar by suspending his sentence in the 2017 case.

Missiles not far away: Pak leader's warning to India over Bangladesh tensionsIn a video statement, Kamran Saeed Usmani, alleged that Pakistan does not accept Bangladesh being pushed into "India's ideological dominance." He warned that if India attacks Bangladesh or even "casts an evil eye" on its autonomy, Pakistan would respond forcefully.

Protected land dispute turns violent in Assam's tribal districts, Internet shutThe protesters are demanding the eviction of settlers they accuse of illegally occupying Village Grazing Reserve (VGR) and Professional Grazing Reserve (PGR) lands - areas protected under the Sixth Schedule of the Constitution to safeguard tribal land rights.

Why is Saudi Arabia witnessing rare snowfall? Science explainedThe unusual episode once again underlined how climate change is harbouring unusual weather in regions that are far from prepared to handle it.

Homebound in legal heat as author alleges film copied 2021 novel, Dharma reactsDharma Productions addressed plagiarism allegations related to the film Homebound through legal channels after author Puja Changoiwala accused them of copying her 2021 novel. The dispute arises as the film, India's official entry for the Oscars, continues its campaign.

Why object to India's actions? Pak leader slams own military's Afghanistan standMaulana Fazlur Rehman posed a direct challenge to the military's justification for targeting militant groups in Afghanistan, drawing a sharp comparison to India's actions in Pakistan.

Jamia suspends professor, to lodge FIR over exam question on Muslim atrocitiesJamia Millia Islamia, a central university, has reportedly suspended a professor of the department of social work over a controversial question in an end-semester exam. The 15-mark question sought a discussion on "atrocities on Muslim minorities in India" with examples. Jamia has said it will file an FIR as per rules.

sports.headline: Rohit-Kohli take centre stage, but stories aplenty in Round 1 The Vijay Hazare Trophy begins on December 24, Wednesday. On Christmas Eve there are many storylines that will keep the fans hooked to the competition. Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma will take centre stage but keep an eye out on others as well. Here is the preview of the Round 1 fixtures.

Security steps in as fans hound Rohit Sharma for selfies in Jaipur Rohit Sharma is in Jaipur to play Vijay Hazare Trophy. Fans thronged to the batter to click selfies after Rohit's net session at the Sawai Man Singh Stadium. One of them misbehaved and was swiftly removed by the security.

No Williamson vs Kohli as New Zealand announce white ball squads for India tour India vs New Zealand: The Blackcaps announced their white ball squads for the series against India. Senior batter Kane Williamson is set to skip the series, while top players return for the T20I leg ahead of the World Cup.

Shafali Verma blitz crushes Sri Lanka in Vizag, fires India Women to 2-0 series lead IND vs SL, 2nd Women's T20I: Shafali Verma's unbeaten 69 powered India to a commanding seven-wicket victory on Tuesday, as they chased down 129 with 49 balls to spare to take a 2-0 series lead.

Virat Kohli, Rohit Sharma return to Vijay Hazare. But can you watch them live? Vijay Hazare: Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma return to domestic cricket on Christmas Eve. Can you watch them play on broadcast or livestream their matches?

Odisha wrestlers' train ordeal: Why no athlete quota in railways, asks ex-Olympian Eighteen young wrestlers from Odisha were forced to sit beside a toilet in a train compartment while travelling for a national championship. The incident has sparked outrage and raised urgent questions about sports planning and athlete support in the state.

Viral videos appear to show England players drunk in Australia amid Ashes nightmare Unverified videos of Ben Duckett and Jacob Bethell's off-field conduct in Noosa have put England under fresh scrutiny, compounding an Ashes campaign that unravelled on and off the field after a 3-0 drubbing by Australia.

Ricky Ponting explains how Harry Brook's mistakes cost England the Ashes Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting has criticised Harry Brook's approach during the Ashes, pointing to the England batter's costly mistakes as a key factor behind England's 3-0 series defeat to Australia.

No Kohli at Chinnaswamy: Govt body denies permission for Vijay Hazare match Vijay Hazare Trophy: The M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru has once again been denied permission to host key matches. The match between Delhi and Gujarat, where Virat Kohli was set to play, has been shifted to the BCCI's Centre of Excellence.

Ravindra Jadeja signals World Cup intent with Vijay Hazare Trophy availability Senior India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has confirmed he will play two matches for Saurashtra in the 2025–26 Vijay Hazare Trophy, as he looks to stay in contention for a place in India's squad for the 2027 ODI World Cup.

Virat Kohli, Rishabh Pant begin training ahead of Delhi's Vijay Hazare Trophy opener Virat Kohli and Rishabh Pant led the way for Delhi as they got their training underway in Bengaluru ahead of the Vijay Hazare Trophy opening fixture set to be played on November 24.

Odisha Minister Nityananda Gond Orders Probe After 18 Wrestlers Forced to Travel Near Train ToiletsIn a shocking incident, 18 young athletes from Odisha were forced to travel near train toilets to the 69th National School Wrestling Championship in Uttar Pradesh due to unconfirmed tickets. The group, comprising 10 boys and 8 girls, endured freezing cold conditions without basic amenities. Responding to the outrage, Odisha School and Mass Education Minister Nityananda Gond stated, 'The government will examine the truth behind the allegations. After the inquiry, necessary action will be taken.' India Today's Anirban Sinha Roy reports on the ordeal that has sparked widespread condemnation.

World Cup hero Jemimah Rodrigues named Delhi Capitals captain for WPL 2026WPL 2026: Jemimah Rodrigues replaced Meg Lanning as Delhi Capitals' skipper for the upcoming edition of the tournament. The right-hander has featured in all three seasons for DC and was in sublime form during the Women's World Cup earlier this year.

2nd WT20I Highlights: Shafali storm leaves Sri Lanka clueless, India win by 7 wicketsIndia Women vs Sri Lanka Women 2nd T20I Highlights: India outclass Sri Lanka with a dominant all-round display, racing to 128 in just 11.5 overs after a strong bowling effort to clinch a seven-wicket win and a commanding 2–0 series lead.

Liverpool's Alexander Isak sidelined for two months, Arne Slot confirmsLiverpool's Alexander Isak faces a lengthy spell on the sidelines following a broken ankle and fibula sustained during a Premier League clash with Tottenham. The incident, described as reckless by coach Arne Slot, comes as a major setback for both the player and club.

No dignity: Odisha govt on the mat as wrestlers forced to sit near train toiletsA video of young Odisha wrestlers travelling for their national championships in the extremely inhumane conditions went viral on Tuesday. After the incident came in the public eye, state minister of school and mass education - Nityananda Gond promised an enquiry.

PM Modi hosts Neeraj Chopra and wife Himani Mor, discusses sports and morePrime Minister Narendra Modi met Neeraj Chopra and his wife Himani Mor at his residence in New Delhi. The meeting highlighted Neeraj's rise from a novice to a world-class javelin thrower and inspired many across India.

Pakistan to notify ICC on India's provocative behaviour in U19 Asia Cup final: ReportPakistan plans to approach the ICC over alleged on-field provocation by Indian players during the Under-19 Asia Cup final.

Messi's sister hospitalised after Miami car crash, wedding postponedLionel Messi's sister, Maria Sol Messi, has been hospitalised after being involved in a serious car crash in Miami, and her wedding planned for early January has been postponed as a result.

Ashwin dissects Stokes' major weakness: Can't play spin same way as fast bowlingRavichandran Ashwin criticised Ben Stokes' technique against spin after England's Ashes defeat in Adelaide. Stokes got bowled out for 5 in the second innings in Adelaide.

Deepti Sharma becomes No. 1 T20I bowler, Smriti Mandhana slips to No.2India all-rounder Deepti Sharma has climbed to No.1 in the ICC T20I bowling rankings after her spell against Sri Lanka. At the same time, Smriti Mandhana has slipped to second in the ODI batting list as South Africa captain Laura Wolvaardt reclaimed the top spot.

Sunil Gavaskar first Indian sportsperson to secure personality rights protectionSunil Gavaskar is the first Indian sportsperson to receive court-backed protection for his personality rights. This landmark ruling sets a precedent for athletes seeking legal control over digital misuse of their identity.

Indonesia's Gede Priandana scripts world record with 5 wickets in an over in T20IsGede Priandana became the first cricketer in T20I history to take five wickets in a single over, powering Indonesia to a dominant victory over Cambodia in Bali. The 28-year-old achieved the extraordinary feat in his very first over of the match, sealing the contest and etching his name into the record books with a new world record.

MS Dhoni the villain? Amit Mishra responds to rumours about his careerFormer India spinner Amit Mishra recently commented on the popular belief that his career would've been different without MS Dhoni in the Indian team.

Pat Cummins doubtful for T20 World Cup? Australia head coach remains hopefulAustralia head coach Andrew McDonald has admitted that Pat Cummins remains a doubtful starter for next year's T20 World Cup in India and Sri Lanka, describing the fast bowler's prospects as "quite grey" at this stage.

Bollywood next? Rohit Sharma steals the show in Stranger Things Netflix promoSuperstar cricketer Rohit Sharma features in a clever Netflix promo blending cricket and Stranger Things themes. Several fans on social media have also praised his acting chops, with many joking that the Indian star looks ready for a Bollywood career after retirement.

England cricketer Andrew Strauss remarries 7 years after death of former wife RuthAndrew Strauss has remarried seven years after losing his wife Ruth to cancer. The former England captain shared the news quietly, marking a new personal chapter after years devoted to family and charity work.

Life in Afghanistan: Rashid Khan says he uses bulletproof car in hometownRashid Khan said he needs a bulletproof car to travel in Afghanistan, leaving Kevin Pietersen shocked during an interview. Rashid, who spends most of his time in Dubai, is one of the most popular cricketers from the country.

Virat Kohli's Vijay Hazare clash at Chinnaswamy unlikely to be open for fans: ReportsVirat Kohli's return to the Chinnaswamy Stadium is set to be a quiet one. Reports suggest Delhi's Vijay Hazare Trophy clash in Bengaluru will be played behind closed doors due to security concerns.

Alexander Isak's Liverpool chapter handed fresh bump: Forward undergoes surgeryAlexander Isak's debut season at Liverpool has been halted by another injury blow. The Swedish striker faces months on the sidelines after undergoing surgery on a fractured ankle and fibula.

Vaibhav Suryavanshi booed by Pakistan fans after India's U-19 Asia Cup lossIndia's teenage batting star Vaibhav Suryavanshi faced boos from Pakistani fans after a heavy defeat in the Under-19 Asia Cup final. Suryavanshi got dismissed for a quickfire 26 off just 10 deliveries by Ali Raza in the summit clash.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
